html:
** Shares of telecom company AAF.L jump as much as 14% to 114.2p - hits record high

** H1 revenue rises by 25.2% to $2.27 bln on the back growing demand for mobile broadband and phone-based financial services

** HY profit after tax has more than doubled to $335 mln

** Growth trajectory will continue, CEO Segun Ogunsanya told Reuters after results were released, driven by demand from a fifth of Africa's population that still has no access to mobile broadband (Full Story)

** Stock top gainer on FTSE mid cap index .FTMC, while also on track to record its best say since Feb. 2020

** "Our revenue growth rates for the half year for the Group and all our service segments are ahead of our FY'21 revenue growth trends, and in reported terms these are all in strong double digit" - Co

** Including session's gains, stock has risen 48.5% YTD


(Reporting by Sinchita Mitra)

(( sinchita.mitra@thomsonreuters.com ))
